920 E Tinkham Ave
Ludington, MI 49431
RE: License #: CB530246146
Staircase Youth Services
920 E Tinkham Ave
Ludington, MI 49431
Dear Ms. Vanhouten:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
July 12, 2022. The study has determined full compliance with applicable licensing
statutes and rules, and the Implementation, Sustainability, and Exit Plan (MISEP)
requirements. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also violations
of the MISEP. As indicated above full compliance has been established therefore, your
license is renewed.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Kari Muntean, Area Manager, at 734-395-0920.
Sincerely,
Doug Turrill, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City, MI 49684
(231) 383-5531

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is in compliance will all MISEP requirements.
3.) The agency is non-contracted.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
The agency is conducting monthly visits to the residence of youth and observing the
safety of the residence at that time. However, on other social work contacts the
worker is documenting that a safety assessment is completed when the contact is
by phone or when the worker meets the youth at the agency office. It was
recommended that the Chief Administrator clarify with workers that ensuring the
safety of the residences of youth is only achieved during the monthly visits to the
youth’s residence.
V. CONSULTATION
Consultation was not requested or offered at this time.
EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
There were no incidents of substantiated child abuse and/or neglect during this
licensing period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this
licensing period.
The agency was not required to submit a corrective action plan during this
licensing period.
Interviews: An agency Youth Specialist was interviewed. The worker reported that
she receives supportive supervision from the agency CA who is also her direct
supervisor. The worker reported that she feels there is a positive and supportive team
at the agency.
Agency Change: During the licensing period the Chief Administrator requested that
the licensing of foster homes be removed from the license. The Chief Administrator
4

reported that the agency had not had a licensed foster home for several years and
they were no longer interested in recruitment and licensing of homes. The Chief
Administrator reported that “host homes” are used for the placement of youth. The
Chief Administrator submitted an application requesting the change and the license
was amended.
VI. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their regular license.
July 26, 2022
________________________________________
Doug Turrill Date
